title: What is the difference between <b> and <strong>?
content: When should each be used semantically?
explanation: <b> is visual bold only. <strong> indicates importance/semantic emphasis, also bold by default. Use <strong> for meaning, <b> for style.
sampleAnswers: <b> is visual bold only. <strong> indicates importance/semantic emphasis, also bold by default. Use <strong> for meaning, <b> for style.

title: Explain the difference between <ul>, <ol>, and <menu>.
content: Include examples for ordered, unordered, and menu lists.
explanation: <ul> unordered list. <ol> ordered list. <menu> list of commands or options, can be context menu or toolbar.
sampleAnswers: <ul> unordered list. <ol> ordered list. <menu> list of commands or options, can be context menu or toolbar.

title: What are semantic HTML elements and why are they important?
content: Give examples of at least 5 semantic elements.
explanation: Semantic HTML gives meaning to content. Examples: <header>, <footer>, <article>, <section>, <nav>. Important for accessibility, SEO, and maintainability.
sampleAnswers: Semantic HTML gives meaning to content. Examples: <header>, <footer>, <article>, <section>, <nav>. Important for accessibility, SEO, and maintainability.

title: Explain the difference between <mark> and <highlight> (if any).
content: Which one is valid in HTML5?
explanation: <mark> is valid in HTML5, used to highlight text. <highlight> is not a valid HTML tag.
sampleAnswers: <mark> is valid in HTML5, used to highlight text. <highlight> is not a valid HTML tag.

title: Explain the difference between <small> and <sub> elements.
explanation: <small> is for fine print or disclaimers. <sub> is for subscripted text, e.g., chemical formulas H₂O.
sampleAnswers: <small> is for fine print or disclaimers. <sub> is for subscripted text, e.g., chemical formulas H₂O.

title: What is the difference between <time> and a simple <span> for dates?
explanation: <time datetime='2025-10-11'>Oct 11, 2025</time> is machine-readable and semantic. <span> is purely visual and lacks semantics.
sampleAnswers: <time datetime='2025-10-11'>Oct 11, 2025</time> is machine-readable and semantic. <span> is purely visual and lacks semantics.

title: How does the <template> element work in HTML5?
content: Provide an example of deferred DOM content that can be cloned via JS.
explanation: . Use JS: document.querySelector('template').content.cloneNode(true) to insert into DOM.
sampleAnswers: . Use JS: document.querySelector('template').content.cloneNode(true) to insert into DOM.

title: Explain how to create an accessible tab interface in HTML5.
content: Which elements, roles, and attributes should be used?
explanation: Use <div role='tablist'>, <button role='tab'>, aria-selected='true|false', aria-controls='tabpanel-id'. Each panel: <div role='tabpanel'> linked via aria-controls.
sampleAnswers: Use <div role='tablist'>, <button role='tab'>, aria-selected='true|false', aria-controls='tabpanel-id'. Each panel: <div role='tabpanel'> linked via aria-controls.

title: What is the difference between <main> and <article>?
explanation: <main> represents the main content of a page (unique per page). <article> is self-contained content that could be reused independently.
sampleAnswers: <main> represents the main content of a page (unique per page). <article> is self-contained content that could be reused independently.

title: What is the difference between <embed> and <object>?
content: Include use cases for embedding PDFs, videos, and other media.
explanation: <embed> is simpler for embedding media directly. <object> is more flexible, can fallback content, and interact with parent document.
sampleAnswers: <embed> is simpler for embedding media directly. <object> is more flexible, can fallback content, and interact with parent document.

content: Provide a simple example using width and max-width.

title: Explain the difference between <script defer> and <script async>.
explanation: defer: script executes after HTML parsing, in order. async: script executes as soon as it's downloaded, order not guaranteed. Use defer for multiple scripts depending on DOM.
sampleAnswers: defer: script executes after HTML parsing, in order. async: script executes as soon as it's downloaded, order not guaranteed. Use defer for multiple scripts depending on DOM.
